Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2024
Review: Found a better vitamin with New Chapter which is just as good (you only have to take 1 a day) and its significantly cheaper. The price on this one literally increased $20 over night when I had it in my cart (from $50 to $70!). I've been using it for years for every pregnancy. Still love how my body feels when I take them, although it always used to give me an unpleasant after taste. I wonder what the flavored version is like. I won't try it until they get their prices back down.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2024
Review: Nada más están muy fuerte el olor

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
Review: I saw that this vitamin got very good reviews on YouTube and I decided to try it out. I really like it a lot.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
Review: Never felt sick taking these!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Review: I love this prenatal. It’s annoying to have to take so many, but I noticed if I took more than one at a time- I don’t get queasy which was really easy for me to be the whole time I was pregnant. 10/10 would recommend!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Review:
I love these vitamins. I’ve been taking them ever since my first pregnancy in 2019 and I’ve kept taking them because I’ve noticed they make a difference compared to other prenatals when it comes to my energy levels as well as my hair and nails.

I reached out to Garden of Life’s customer service and they said that they expect more stock at the end of March/beginning of April. High demand and unexpected supply chain issues have made these unavailable from many retailers, but these prenatals are still in production and should be available again at their regular prices soon.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
Review: I have been using this since my last pregnancy and am trying to continue, but am losing patience with the recent supply issues and am on the verge of looking for another brand. The product itself is excellent in terms of composition of vitamins and you just need to take another omega 3's supplement. More recently, however, I've noticed that it is always out of stock on Amazon. If I can't access it, I can't take it and I don't have the bandwidth to keep checking online. I am breastfeeding and can't afford to go a long time without pre/post-natals

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
Review:
I love love love this product. I used it for two pregancies, one a single and the other twins. Delivered happy, healthy, brilliant babies. Another bonus was I didn't experience the nausea I felt with the pharmaceutical prenatal vitamins. Loved it so much I went back to it about a year after I stopped nursing just for me, after noticing my energy levels were not keeping up with 3 toddlers. And just like that I was back in the game full of energy again. After all the bottle read for mother and baby, and I was a mother trying to keep up with her babies. Not to mention the perk of healthy long hair and nails. I can go on about this product for days.

Now, that price is ridiculous. The price has gone up 3× the amount in the last year. There is a difference between inflation and greedy. The product is great. It sells itself and I know I can't be the only one that recommended it to friends, loved ones, and total strangers. Then you hike the price up on us. A shame and a pity is what I call that. I'll wait for the price to drop. I always have an extra bottle because it's that good.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
Review: Loved this prenatal through the beginning of my pregnancy. Now all of a sudden it's been impossible to order since the beginning of December. Sad I'm now left trying to find a different prenatal for when my stock runs out.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
Review: Great product recommended by my fertility clinic but it’s 3x a day so at times I forget to take it. The price of product also went up significantly. I bought the 180 quantity back in September of 2023 for $45!!! Now it’s $99!!! INSANE.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
Review: So thankful for these! I feel peace of mind knowing that I'm using a prenatal that is all-natural and has ingredients that I can understand and pronounce. Sadly, they're a bit hard to swallow and if you burp after taking one, it's an unpleasant taste. However, I think it's worth it to have a prenatal with ingredients I can trust!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
Review: Love these,a little expensive, no smell, good ingredients

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
Review: Taste is horrible. :/

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
Review: I am currently in my third trimester of my first pregnancy. I was very sick in the beginning and having a hard time finding a prenatal that I could stomach. Many of the others I tried had a nasty taste or caused me to burp them up hours after taking the vitamin. These do not have a taste or smell and have no burp up affect after the vitamin has been taken. I will continue to take these for the rest of my pregnancies. The quality of the vitamin is top notch I also like how it has Folate instead of Folic Acid a better form for the pregnant mother to be taking. I am confident my baby and my body are getting all the nutrients they need in this pregnancy.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
Review: I’ve been buying these since being pregnant with my 21 month old son. Just started noticing they appear to be burnt!?

Review Title: Clean Product and ingredients!! Only wish it were organic!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
Review: I did quite a bit of research before choosing this product. It is fantastic that it is full of all natural ingredients so you don't have to worry about byproducts from synthetic components or heavy metals. The only thing I wish they would do differently is use organic ingredients since non-organic is now well researched. But it was a better option than synthetic! They did have a product that was more organic, but it had an herb in it that was used a contraceptive so I went with this option. Please make an organic version!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
Review: These do not work for me personally because they contain fish oil, so I’m not able to swallow them while pregnant due to the after taste.

Review Title: Contains heavy metals, pesticides and BPA
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
Review: Dangerous toxic chemicals are found in the product. Clean Label Project, a non-profit organization, tested these supplements in 2021 for toxic ingredients. The results found that the Products “contained quantifiable levels of heavy metals as well as detectable amounts of WHO Class II Pesticides and BPA”. Please search for the civil action.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
Review: Prenatal vitamins should be taken

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
Review: Excellent quality, good health support, I recommend using them 1 or 2 times a year.

Review Title: Great product but check your vitamin jar before return window closes
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
Review:
Bought in bulk with sale on Amazon. Just went to open last jar and ALL the vitamins dropped into the box as the bottom of the glass jar was shattered. Couldn’t safely use any of the vitamins so out an entire bottle and outside return window.
The prenatal is great! Took during pregnancy without any issues! It’s 3 capsules but they go down easy.

Review Title: Won’t replace item when came damaged!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
Review: I take them all the time even though I'm past having my babies. They make me feel good and they make my nails grow long!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
Review: Took this all throughout my pregnancy and even 5 months into postpartum and they worked great. I gave birth to a healthy baby boy and post partum my son and I have very strong nails that grow right back when we cut/trim them. I am switching to a different multivitamin but under the same brand. Now that I’m back to work and juggling that and my baby, I can’t keep up with the thrice daily recommended dose.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
Review: The cons is that it's 3xs a day and it gives me severe heartburn. For moms suffering from heartburn these make it 10xs worse. My DR recommended I switch prenatals.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
Review: I am not pregnant but I started losing a lot of hair, probably stress. It is getting better and my nails are great.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
Review: Excelente vitaminas prenatales, todo va muy bien.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
Review: I love it so far! On my second bottle!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
Review: Great vitamin just what the doctor ordered for my menopause of all things

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
Review: Love that it’s raw and organic, without all the yucky additives. The taste is not great going down. I usually take with some water and can taste it for a second before it goes down. It’s a nice size, so a little tough to get down at times without gagging. Which has become more sensitive with my pregnancy. Me and baby are staying healthy though!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
Review: These taste absolutely disgusting, and linger for a bit after you’ve swallowed them. Then to add to it you have to take them 3 times a day. Disappointed with this purchase. I won’t be finishing the bottle.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
Review: The bottle came with the seal open and a yellow stain on it. I want to return it but it says not elegible for return.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
Review: I truly enjoy these vitamins. It is just 3 at a time(I had one which required 6 before). My nails seem stronger and my hair thicker, i feel healthier and which makes me believe in their completeness of vitamins. They do not upset my stomach which is also a plus.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
Review: I was told this was the gold standard of pre natals on the market so I felt confident in my purchase. This is my first child so I didn’t know what to expect with first trimester morning sickness. I thought I was having a realllly bad first trimester. Terrible headaches everyday, terrible constipation, sick to my stomach, nauseous, tired, muscle aches and my mental health was being flushed down the toilet. A few weeks ago I got so sick one night that I decided to take a break from my vitamins for a day and to my surprise, all of my symptoms subsided substantially. I decided to skip the next day to see what would happen and felt even better. I don’t know if it’s because Nestle bought this company over and has tampered with the quality/ingredients or not. But I do know I spent two months very sick and didn’t need to. I started a new prenatal that next day and no negative symptoms have returned. I would not buy this product. Do your research on how little concern Nestle has for new mothers. Wish I could give 0 stars.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
Review: I ordered these because they were highly rated and seemed to be a good organic option. They seemed to work well- I didn’t have any problems with feeling nauseous after taking them BUT!!! I am pretty certain they caused me to have constipation. Once I switched back to my usual prenatal that issue went away.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
Review: Ordered on 10/21/2023 and just opened today (10/25/2023) to find this $50 bottle open and defective

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
Review: I didn't have nausea before, but every time i take this vitamin, the smell makes my stomach upset, and i feel like i'm going to vomit. The size is also too large, and even when i try to swallow one at a time, it gets caught in my throat, causing a bad smell to come up, and i don't feel well. I won't buy this product again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
Review: Been using these for years throughout my pregnancies. Never had a problem like some do with saying their prenatals make them feel awful.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
Review:
Play Video
Ordered 2 bottles and one of them was so shattered the glass was coming out from the bottom and almost cut myself with it!!!! Very disappointed!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
Review:
I used to take One a Day and after my pregnancy blood tests came back with low iron results, I switched to this brand. These vitamins helped get my iron to normal levels and I now have a very healthy 4 month old! I’ve been also taking these postpartum and I feel like I haven’t had some of the postpartum symptoms like hair loss and it could be due to the vitamins, but not sure. These vitamins made my nails stronger and grow faster that’s for sure - my nails used to break all the time and were very brittle and thin. I don’t take the full dose 2 instead of 3 per day, and it has still worked great. I have these on a subscription now, I love them so much.

One thing I feel like I have to say — you absolutely MUST drink lots of water any time you take vitamins with iron. If you continue taking these after giving birth, you need to get a laxative, or else be prepared for the most painful poop of your life. It will bring you to tears. Just trust me.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
Review: You have to take the vitamin 3x a day. Also tastes terrible. I've never throw up a pill before but these I've throw up a few times.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
Review: The entire glass bottle of vitamins were busted open and glass shards were mixed in with the vitamin in the bottom of the box. Trying to get a replacement

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
Review: This is an easy to take multivitamin, with no fishy taste. Nice way to get all the minerals you need.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023

Would highly recommend this brand as they do not contain fillers and are full of fruits and veggies which are easy on the stomach. I would highly recommend Garden of Life Vitamins not only the Prenatal but all that they carry.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
Review: I can't speak to how effective these are as I only took a few but I can't NOT stand the taste or smell of these. And after taking them I burb the flavor of them up for awhile and it's awful

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
Review: My favorite vitamins

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
Review:
The product itself is wonderful. Seems to meet all nutritional needs during pregnancy and does not make you more nauseous.
However, serving size is 3 pills and they only give you 30. If you take as directed, that means that's only 10 days before you're out. That is INSANE and makes it way overpriced.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
Review: These vitamins definitely were a great addition to my health regimen. Before I started using this my vitamin readings were very low, and I was suffering from Alopecia. I believe in working from the inside out so I decided to give these vitamins a try before considering steroid treatment. Well after almost a month of use, I first started noticing better nail growth, and not breaking so easily. Then one day I realized my hair had gotten thicker and longer; before, it was thin and sluggish. It has been filling in slowly. My last checkup had much better results from the lab work and I wasn't so deficient as before. My recovery has also improved after bike riding, with the boost in vitamins, so I would say these are great even if you're not trying to conceive! I can definitely say after my own use that good vitamins make a world of difference in my life.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
Review: Made my skin break out like crazy. Worst decision to get these. I don’t know what they put in them but it was toxic to my body.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
Review: I’m not sure how to feel about these, besides totally freaked out. I researched a ton of natural prenatals and came upon this one and figured it was a safe choice; I used to take Garden of Life probiotics and always had trust in the brand. But these have thrown me off. I took the whole bottle over a couple months, I was down to the last 5 or 6 and noticed one with black like burnt almost sludge on a corner. So I tossed it out without thinking. Then went to take another one and noticed it looked darker than usual… so I popped open the brand new bottle that I had auto delivered and noticed for sure that the new bottle pills were super light and the remaining ones of the old bottle had turned darker and actually felt hard when I squeezed them. So that plus that were black sludgy one has me freaked out. If anyone from the company can reach out and let me (and the rest of the reviewers saying similar things) know that this is normal, or what the explanation is, I’d appreciate it. I’d really love to know if I’ve been poisoning myself and my unborn child for 3 months.

Review Title: Bad taste and smell after opened
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
Review: The vitamins start to smell and taste really bad after one-two weeks. Company is aware of the issue and claims that it’s normal and safe, but good luck if you’re pregnant and nauseated taking these. Don’t recommend.

No idea if I can even return now that I opened it and took THREE! YUCK YUCK YUCK. DO NOT BUY!!! Blah

Review Title: A pregnancy ESSENTIAL- Non-GMO & Gentle on the Stomach
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
Review:
I can't sing enough praises for Garden of Life Prenatal Vitamins. These little gems have been my go-to companion throughout my pregnancy journey, and they've truly exceeded my expectations.

One of the standout features of these vitamins is their gentleness on the stomach. Unlike some other prenatal vitamins I've tried, these never caused me any discomfort or stomach aches. It's such a relief to have a product that supports my health and my baby's development without causing any unnecessary discomfort.

The comprehensive nutrient profile of these vitamins is another major win. Knowing that I'm providing my body with all the essential nutrients needed for a healthy pregnancy gives me peace of mind. From folate to iron and beyond, Garden of Life has covered all the bases to support both me and my growing baby.

Perhaps the cherry on top is the fact that these prenatal vitamins are certified non-GMO. In a world where quality matters, it's reassuring to know that I'm consuming a product that meets the highest standards of purity and sustainability.

In conclusion, Garden of Life Prenatal Vitamins have been an integral part of my pregnancy wellness routine. They're gentle on the stomach, packed with vital nutrients, and proudly certified non-GMO. I wholeheartedly recommend these vitamins to any expectant mothers looking for a reliable and holistic way to support their pregnancy journey.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
Review: ive only been taking these for about a week and i havent noticed or felt any different especially being as though it is just a vitamin. However i will say i have tried soooo many prenatals in the last 3 years on my TTC journey from target brand, one a day, walmart brand, walgreens brand, spring valley, conceive easy, pink stork, mary ruths and many more and this brand is definitely in my top 5 of just over all healthy, cleaner prenatals. Some make me constipated, some gives headaches, some makes me nauseous and i just have no had these issues with this one. it is pricey but it also feels like a good quality prenatal. i also buy these to have on hand especially since i am TTC and have been for so long and this one for sure will be one that i add to my monthly shopping list.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023

Review Title: The reason that I like Garden of Life Prenatal ...
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
Review: is because it's not just any ordinary prenatal vitamin. It's a superhero in disguise, fighting off morning sickness and keeping me feeling great throughout my pregnancy. This vitamin is Non-GMO Project Verified, so I know I'm getting the best quality ingredients for myself and my baby. Plus, it's gluten-free and kosher, so it fits into my dietary restrictions with ease. The neural development support from iron, folate, and vitamins C and D3 gives me peace of mind, knowing that my baby's brain is getting all the nutrients it needs. And let's not forget about the added bonus of probiotics for immune support. This vitamin truly has it all! It's like having a personal nutritionist in a bottle. I can't recommend Garden of Life Prenatal Multivitamin enough. Say goodbye to nausea and hello to a healthy and happy pregnancy with this amazing product!

Review: I used this product in all three of my pregnancies. I found it was the only prenatal that didn't make me feel sick to my stomach while pregnant. The downfall is having to take three, but I would rather do that than fill miserable. Great product and quality!

The flavor is foul - fishy and unpleasant. Probably even more intolerable when you’re pregnant and sensitive to everything. I didn’t want to deal with trying to get a third bottle delivered so I moved to a different brand. I don’t recommend.

Review Title: Prenatal Multivitamin: An Essential Companion f...
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
Review: I really like the features of the Garden of Life Prenatal Multivitamin for Women with Iron, Folate & Vitamin C and D3 for Neural Development & Probiotics for Immune Support. As a mom-to-be, I want nothing but the best for my baby, and this product delivers on that front. The neural development support it provides is truly remarkable, ensuring that my little one gets the nutrients needed for their brain development. Plus, the comprehensive multi-nutrient formula covers all the bases, giving me peace of mind that I'm getting everything I need during this crucial time. And let's not forget about the over 20 fruits and veggies packed into each serving! It's like a garden in a bottle, providing me with a natural source of vitamins and minerals. Garden of Life has truly thought of everything when it comes to this prenatal vitamin. Not only is it non-GMO and gluten-free, but it's also kosher, making it suitable for a wide range of dietary needs. With a 60-day supply, I know I'll be covered...

Review Title: Don't recommend for those this bad morning sickness
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
Review: Garden of Life is my go to brand for vitamins so when I found out I was pregnant I immediately bought these. I vomited them up everytime I tried to take them. They were way too hard on my stomach. Not to mention you're supposed to take 4 of them throughout the day so I was pretty much constantly nauseated. It's just too much when you're likely already experiencing a sensitive stomach. But I gave them to my friend and she likes them so gave them some stars back for credit since some women can miraculously stomach these. Just would not recommend for those of us who have a lot of upset stomach from baby.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2023
Review: Prenatal vitamins typically make me nauseous, these don’t have that effect. Love the ingredients and that they are a raw prenatal. Great product!

Review Title: Loved these for years. Recent bottle is putrid.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2023
Review: ­Anyone know how to contact the seller? I've used these vitamins for many years, through multiple pregnancies and years of breastfeeding. My doctor highly approves of this brand, and my lab work always looks great. I have been pleased with most of the Garden of Life products I've used, but my most recent bottle of Raw Prenatal has a very putrid smell, and I'm afraid to take it. This hasn't happened before.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
Review: I've had headaches as long as I remember, was popping Tylenol like candy, but I take these vitamins now and my head almost never hurts. My last pregnancy I had terrible migraines and nausea. This time the nausea is not that bad, I have more energy than I had before I got pregnant and my head rarely hurts. I took another vitamin once and it made me feel horrible, do I feel like it's all thanks to vitamin code.

Review: there are better prenatal vitamins

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2023
Review: 3 capsules per serving with only 30 capsules. Why did I pay this much money for only 10 days. Average supply for any pill type product is 30 day supply

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2023
Review: I switched to this prenatal about halfway through my pregnancy and noticed a huge difference! My old prenatals were making me nauseous, but these actually helped my nausea and I finally felt my energy come back! The smell and taste are unpleasant, so I would recommend taking these while holding your breath or with some juice. You also have to take three per day, which isn’t a big deal once you get into the habit of it. Nutrition is super important during pregnancy, especially if you have morning sickness and unable to eat a balanced diet. I highly recommend these!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
Review: I have PCOS and my hormones and health were very out of whack, my friend recommended these and it has made such and improvement in my body balance, highly recommend

Review Title: Actually nourishes - helped with anemic symptoms
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2023
Review: I was taking women’s one a day prenatal. In my third trimester I got a craving for ice, which is a sign for iron deficiency. I switched to this prenatal and my craving went away! Very impressed by and thankful for this product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2023
Review:
I love this, it was so gentle on my stomach when I was pregnant. My baby is 4months old now and I. Still taking this vitamins.
The last one I ordered came destroyed but it was replaced immediately, and I was so great full with the quick response.
The one thing I don't like about this is having to take three times a day, whish ot was just one pill a day. But l love the product anyway.

Review Title: AMAZING results to help with menstrual issues
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
Review: I am 37, and starting about 5 or so years ago I started having regular spotting or bleeding between my cycles, as well as bleeding after intimate relations, which got so bad the past 2 years or so that I was basically spotting or bleeding every day all month long almost every month. I began taking these daily, and noticed slow but steady improvement within a month. Within 3 months, my bleeding and spotting between periods was all but gone! I have been taking these regularly for a little over a year, and any time I slack on it by going too many days without taking it in the month, the spotting comes back. I usually only take 2 a day, sometimes one, but that is enough. This vitamin is seriously amazing. I recommended it to my older sister that also had spotting issues, and she noticed a positive difference as well. HIGHLY 100% RECOMMEND!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
Review: It had weird smell (may be a sea kelp ) while swallowing and even I had a bad fishy burps through out the day

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023

I've bought this one for a friend and she is having a very healthy pregnancy

https://amzn.to/3IVTveA

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2023
Review: Love these prenatal vitamins. I have tried others before and I feel that these are more natural and don’t have any sort of after taste. I have also found them to help a bit more with digestion.

The price on this one literally increased $20 over night when I had it in my cart (from $50 to $70!). I've been using it for years for every pregnancy. Still love how my body feels when I take them, although it always used to give me an unpleasant after taste. I wonder what the flavored version is like. I won't try it until they get their prices back down.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Review: I love this prenatal. It’s annoying to have to take so many, but I noticed if I took more than one at a time- I don’t get queasy which was really easy for me to be the whole time I was pregnant. 10/10 would recommend!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Review:
I love these vitamins. I’ve been taking them ever since my first pregnancy in 2019 and I’ve kept taking them because I’ve noticed they make a difference compared to other prenatals when it comes to my energy levels as well as my hair and nails.

I reached out to Garden of Life’s customer service and they said that they expect more stock at the end of March/beginning of April. High demand and unexpected supply chain issues have made these unavailable from many retailers, but these prenatals are still in production and should be available again at their regular prices soon.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
Review: I have been using this since my last pregnancy and am trying to continue, but am losing patience with the recent supply issues and am on the verge of looking for another brand. The product itself is excellent in terms of composition of vitamins and you just need to take another omega 3's supplement. More recently, however, I've noticed that it is always out of stock on Amazon. If I can't access it, I can't take it and I don't have the bandwidth to keep checking online. I am breastfeeding and can't afford to go a long time without pre/post-natals

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
Review:
I love love love this product. I used it for two pregancies, one a single and the other twins. Delivered happy, healthy, brilliant babies. Another bonus was I didn't experience the nausea I felt with the pharmaceutical prenatal vitamins. Loved it so much I went back to it about a year after I stopped nursing just for me, after noticing my energy levels were not keeping up with 3 toddlers. And just like that I was back in the game full of energy again. After all the bottle read for mother and baby, and I was a mother trying to keep up with her babies. Not to mention the perk of healthy long hair and nails. I can go on about this product for days.

Now, that price is ridiculous. The price has gone up 3× the amount in the last year. There is a difference between inflation and greedy. The product is great. It sells itself and I know I can't be the only one that recommended it to friends, loved ones, and total strangers. Then you hike the price up on us. A shame and a pity is what I call that. I'll wait for the price to drop. I always have an extra bottle because it's that good.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
Review: Loved this prenatal through the beginning of my pregnancy. Now all of a sudden it's been impossible to order since the beginning of December. Sad I'm now left trying to find a different prenatal for when my stock runs out.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
Review: Great product recommended by my fertility clinic but it’s 3x a day so at times I forget to take it. The price of product also went up significantly. I bought the 180 quantity back in September of 2023 for $45!!! Now it’s $99!!! INSANE.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
Review: So thankful for these! I feel peace of mind knowing that I'm using a prenatal that is all-natural and has ingredients that I can understand and pronounce. Sadly, they're a bit hard to swallow and if you burp after taking one, it's an unpleasant taste. However, I think it's worth it to have a prenatal with ingredients I can trust!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
Review: Love these,a little expensive, no smell, good ingredients

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
Review: I am currently in my third trimester of my first pregnancy. I was very sick in the beginning and having a hard time finding a prenatal that I could stomach. Many of the others I tried had a nasty taste or caused me to burp them up hours after taking the vitamin. These do not have a taste or smell and have no burp up affect after the vitamin has been taken. I will continue to take these for the rest of my pregnancies. The quality of the vitamin is top notch I also like how it has Folate instead of Folic Acid a better form for the pregnant mother to be taking. I am confident my baby and my body are getting all the nutrients they need in this pregnancy.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024

Review Title: Clean Product and ingredients!! Only wish it were organic!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
Review: I did quite a bit of research before choosing this product. The only thing I wish they would do differently is use organic ingredients since non-organic is now well researched. But it was a better option than synthetic! They did have a product that was more organic, but it had an herb in it that was used a contraceptive so I went with this option. Please make an organic version!

Review Title: Contains heavy metals, pesticides and BPA
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
Review: Dangerous toxic chemicals are found in the product. Clean Label Project, a non-profit organization, tested these supplements in 2021 for toxic ingredients. The results found that the Products “contained quantifiable levels of heavy metals as well as detectable amounts of WHO Class II Pesticides and BPA”. Please search for the civil action.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
Review: I truly enjoy these vitamins. It is just 3 at a time(I had one which required 6 before). My nails seem stronger and my hair thicker, i feel healthier and which makes me believe in their completeness of vitamins. They do not upset my stomach which is also a plus.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
Review: I was told this was the gold standard of pre natals on the market so I felt confident in my purchase. This is my first child so I didn’t know what to expect with first trimester morning sickness. I thought I was having a realllly bad first trimester. Terrible headaches everyday, terrible constipation, sick to my stomach, nauseous, tired, muscle aches and my mental health was being flushed down the toilet. A few weeks ago I got so sick one night that I decided to take a break from my vitamins for a day and to my surprise, all of my symptoms subsided substantially. I decided to skip the next day to see what would happen and felt even better. I don’t know if it’s because Nestle bought this company over and has tampered with the quality/ingredients or not. But I do know I spent two months very sick and didn’t need to. I started a new prenatal that next day and no negative symptoms have returned. I would not buy this product. Do your research on how little concern Nestle has for new mothers. Wish I could give 0 stars.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
Review: I ordered these because they were highly rated and seemed to be a good organic option. They seemed to work well- I didn’t have any problems with feeling nauseous after taking them BUT!!! I am pretty certain they caused me to have constipation. Once I switched back to my usual prenatal that issue went away.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
Review: Ordered on 10/21/2023 and just opened today (10/25/2023) to find this $50 bottle open and defective

The size is also too large, and even when i try to swallow one at a time, it gets caught in my throat, causing a bad smell to come up, and i don't feel well. I won't buy this product again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
Review: Been using these for years throughout my pregnancies. Never had a problem like some do with saying their prenatals make them feel awful.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
Review:
Play Video
Ordered 2 bottles and one of them was so shattered the glass was coming out from the bottom and almost cut myself with it!!!! Very disappointed!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
Review:
I used to take One a Day and after my pregnancy blood tests came back with low iron results, I switched to this brand. These vitamins helped get my iron to normal levels and I now have a very healthy 4 month old! I’ve been also taking these postpartum and I feel like I haven’t had some of the postpartum symptoms like hair loss and it could be due to the vitamins, but not sure. These vitamins made my nails stronger and grow faster that’s for sure - my nails used to break all the time and were very brittle and thin. I don’t take the full dose 2 instead of 3 per day, and it has still worked great. I have these on a subscription now, I love them so much.

One thing I feel like I have to say — you absolutely MUST drink lots of water any time you take vitamins with iron. If you continue taking these after giving birth, you need to get a laxative, or else be prepared for the most painful poop of your life. It will bring you to tears. Just trust me.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
Review: My favorite vitamins

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
Review:
The product itself is wonderful. Seems to meet all nutritional needs during pregnancy and does not make you more nauseous.
However, serving size is 3 pills and they only give you 30. If you take as directed, that means that's only 10 days before you're out. That is INSANE and makes it way overpriced.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
Review: These vitamins definitely were a great addition to my health regimen. Before I started using this my vitamin readings were very low, and I was suffering from Alopecia. I believe in working from the inside out so I decided to give these vitamins a try before considering steroid treatment. Well after almost a month of use, I first started noticing better nail growth, and not breaking so easily. Then one day I realized my hair had gotten thicker and longer; before, it was thin and sluggish. It has been filling in slowly. My last checkup had much better results from the lab work and I wasn't so deficient as before. My recovery has also improved after bike riding, with the boost in vitamins, so I would say these are great even if you're not trying to conceive! I can definitely say after my own use that good vitamins make a world of difference in my life.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
Review: Made my skin break out like crazy. Worst decision to get these. I don’t know what they put in them but it was toxic to my body.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
Review: I’m not sure how to feel about these, besides totally freaked out. I researched a ton of natural prenatals and came upon this one and figured it was a safe choice; I used to take Garden of Life probiotics and always had trust in the brand. But these have thrown me off. I took the whole bottle over a couple months, I was down to the last 5 or 6 and noticed one with black like burnt almost sludge on a corner. So I tossed it out without thinking. Then went to take another one and noticed it looked darker than usual… so I popped open the brand new bottle that I had auto delivered and noticed for sure that the new bottle pills were super light and the remaining ones of the old bottle had turned darker and actually felt hard when I squeezed them. So that plus that were black sludgy one has me freaked out. If anyone from the company can reach out and let me (and the rest of the reviewers saying similar things) know that this is normal, or what the explanation is, I’d appreciate it. I’d really love to know if I’ve been poisoning myself and my unborn child for 3 months.

No idea if I can even return now that I opened it and took THREE! YUCK YUCK YUCK. DO NOT BUY!!! Blah

Review Title: A pregnancy ESSENTIAL- Non-GMO & Gentle on the Stomach
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
Review:
I can't sing enough praises for Garden of Life Prenatal Vitamins. These little gems have been my go-to companion throughout my pregnancy journey, and they've truly exceeded my expectations.

One of the standout features of these vitamins is their gentleness on the stomach. Unlike some other prenatal vitamins I've tried, these never caused me any discomfort or stomach aches. It's such a relief to have a product that supports my health and my baby's development without causing any unnecessary discomfort.

The comprehensive nutrient profile of these vitamins is another major win. Knowing that I'm providing my body with all the essential nutrients needed for a healthy pregnancy gives me peace of mind. From folate to iron and beyond, Garden of Life has covered all the bases to support both me and my growing baby.

Perhaps the cherry on top is the fact that these prenatal vitamins are certified non-GMO. In a world where quality matters, it's reassuring to know that I'm consuming a product that meets the highest standards of purity and sustainability.

In conclusion, Garden of Life Prenatal Vitamins have been an integral part of my pregnancy wellness routine. They're gentle on the stomach, packed with vital nutrients, and proudly certified non-GMO. I wholeheartedly recommend these vitamins to any expectant mothers looking for a reliable and holistic way to support their pregnancy journey.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
Review: ive only been taking these for about a week and i havent noticed or felt any different especially being as though it is just a vitamin. However i will say i have tried soooo many prenatals in the last 3 years on my TTC journey from target brand, one a day, walmart brand, walgreens brand, spring valley, conceive easy, pink stork, mary ruths and many more and this brand is definitely in my top 5 of just over all healthy, cleaner prenatals. Some make me constipated, some gives headaches, some makes me nauseous and i just have no had these issues with this one. it is pricey but it also feels like a good quality prenatal. i also buy these to have on hand especially since i am TTC and have been for so long and this one for sure will be one that i add to my monthly shopping list.

Review Title: The reason that I like Garden of Life Prenatal ...
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
Review: is because it's not just any ordinary prenatal vitamin. It's a superhero in disguise, fighting off morning sickness and keeping me feeling great throughout my pregnancy. This vitamin is Non-GMO Project Verified, so I know I'm getting the best quality ingredients for myself and my baby. Plus, it's gluten-free and kosher, so it fits into my dietary restrictions with ease. The neural development support from iron, folate, and vitamins C and D3 gives me peace of mind, knowing that my baby's brain is getting all the nutrients it needs. And let's not forget about the added bonus of probiotics for immune support. This vitamin truly has it all! It's like having a personal nutritionist in a bottle. I can't recommend Garden of Life Prenatal Multivitamin enough. Say goodbye to nausea and hello to a healthy and happy pregnancy with this amazing product!

Review Title: Prenatal Multivitamin: An Essential Companion f...

Plus, the comprehensive multi-nutrient formula covers all the bases, giving me peace of mind that I'm getting everything I need during this crucial time. And let's not forget about the over 20 fruits and veggies packed into each serving! It's like a garden in a bottle, providing me with a natural source of vitamins and minerals. Garden of Life has truly thought of everything when it comes to this prenatal vitamin. Not only is it non-GMO and gluten-free, but it's also kosher, making it suitable for a wide range of dietary needs. With a 60-day supply, I know I'll be covered...

You need to take 3 pills a day and I like to do it all at once because then I will forget. Annnd I got a lot heartburn guess because of that (not sure). They also have a strong smell but natural. And the most in usual was to find a broken capsule and a empty one. This is my review and my experience. Maybe this can work for you, you just need to try it 🤷🏻‍♀️

Review Title: Don't recommend for those this bad morning sickness
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
Review: Garden of Life is my go to brand for vitamins so when I found out I was pregnant I immediately bought these. I vomited them up everytime I tried to take them. They were way too hard on my stomach. Not to mention you're supposed to take 4 of them throughout the day so I was pretty much constantly nauseated. It's just too much when you're likely already experiencing a sensitive stomach. But I gave them to my friend and she likes them so gave them some stars back for credit since some women can miraculously stomach these. Just would not recommend for those of us who have a lot of upset stomach from baby.

Review: Prenatal vitamins typically make me nauseous, these don’t have that effect. Love the ingredients and that they are a raw prenatal. Great product!

Review: Loved these. Greta source of nutrients needed while pregnant in whole food form.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
Review: If your looking for a clean prenatal that is just amazing then you have found it! I love these and have been taking them since week 14! Only thing id say is to refrigerate if you cant deal with weird taste. But if you get over the taste these are amazing

Review: These are great for every day use! I take them even if I’m not trying to get pregnant.

Review Title: Loved these for years. Recent bottle is putrid.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2023
Review: ­Anyone know how to contact the seller? I've used these vitamins for many years, through multiple pregnancies and years of breastfeeding. My doctor highly approves of this brand, and my lab work always looks great. I have been pleased with most of the Garden of Life products I've used, but my most recent bottle of Raw Prenatal has a very putrid smell, and I'm afraid to take it. This hasn't happened before.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
Review: I've had headaches as long as I remember, was popping Tylenol like candy, but I take these vitamins now and my head almost never hurts. My last pregnancy I had terrible migraines and nausea. This time the nausea is not that bad, I have more energy than I had before I got pregnant and my head rarely hurts. I took another vitamin once and it made me feel horrible, do I feel like it's all thanks to vitamin code.

Review: there are better prenatal vitamins

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2023
Review: I found this pill in my bottle of vitamin. This is unacceptable!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2023
Review: 3 capsules per serving with only 30 capsules. Why did I pay this much money for only 10 days. Average supply for any pill type product is 30 day supply

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2023
Review: I switched to this prenatal about halfway through my pregnancy and noticed a huge difference! My old prenatals were making me nauseous, but these actually helped my nausea and I finally felt my energy come back! The smell and taste are unpleasant, so I would recommend taking these while holding your breath or with some juice. You also have to take three per day, which isn’t a big deal once you get into the habit of it. Nutrition is super important during pregnancy, especially if you have morning sickness and unable to eat a balanced diet. I highly recommend these!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
Review: I have PCOS and my hormones and health were very out of whack, my friend recommended these and it has made such and improvement in my body balance, highly recommend

Review Title: Actually nourishes - helped with anemic symptoms
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2023
Review: I was taking women’s one a day prenatal. In my third trimester I got a craving for ice, which is a sign for iron deficiency. I switched to this prenatal and my craving went away! Very impressed by and thankful for this product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2023
Review:
I love this, it was so gentle on my stomach when I was pregnant. My baby is 4months old now and I. Still taking this vitamins.
The last one I ordered came destroyed but it was replaced immediately, and I was so great full with the quick response.
The one thing I don't like about this is having to take three times a day, whish ot was just one pill a day. But l love the product anyway.

Review Title: AMAZING results to help with menstrual issues
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
Review: I am 37, and starting about 5 or so years ago I started having regular spotting or bleeding between my cycles, as well as bleeding after intimate relations, which got so bad the past 2 years or so that I was basically spotting or bleeding every day all month long almost every month. I began taking these daily, and noticed slow but steady improvement within a month. Within 3 months, my bleeding and spotting between periods was all but gone! I have been taking these regularly for a little over a year, and any time I slack on it by going too many days without taking it in the month, the spotting comes back. I usually only take 2 a day, sometimes one, but that is enough. This vitamin is seriously amazing. I recommended it to my older sister that also had spotting issues, and she noticed a positive difference as well. HIGHLY 100% RECOMMEND!!

Review: Kinda big to swallow but worth the money, they made my hair grow like crazy!!
